cheadline: 我们需要怎样的公共阅读？
clongleadbody: 岳源：好的公共阅读是一种对价值判断和平等的尊重，谈论格调高低是自大的表现，谁也没有权利去笑话他人坚信的价值。
cbody:
近几日，“下架整改”成了中国大陆互联网行业的热词。“今日头条”、“凤凰”、“网易”均被广电总局点名整改，要求暂停其移动客户端下载服务。

在这些整改令中，最受关注的是4月10日广电总局对“今日头条”的整改令，除了责成其暂停客户端下载外，还要求“今日头条”永久关停旗下“内涵段子”客户端软件及公众号，理由是“存在导向不正、格调低俗等突出问题，引发网民强烈反感。”

“今日头条”和旗下“内涵段子”是当下中国网络公共阅读领域的代表性产品，“今日头条”以其独特算法为卖点向用户推荐信息，“内涵段子”则主打搞笑内容，在下架前已积聚2亿用户，庞大的用户数量和流行程度自然引来更多关注。

被勒令整改的“今日头条”们均属于提供公共信息阅读服务，追求最大的用户数量和最多点击阅读量。这些颇为流行的公共阅读服务的被迫整改，让我们不得不在此时思考一个问题：我们需要怎样的公共阅读？

何为公共阅读？《重返公共阅读》的作者王晓渔说是与公民常识有关的阅读。这话很对，但我认为公共阅读并非仅仅指阅读的内容，还包含一种社会参与。“公”为公有，“共”为合力，就如同“公民”的内涵一样，强调阅读能够成为参与社会的一种方式，公众通过阅读来获取信息，同时能够通过反馈表达，来参与社会事务。它是一种阅读行为，更是一种阅读氛围。

好的公共阅读，在我看来既要有好的阅读内容，也要有好的阅读环境，二者缺一不可，这种公共阅读，有丰富的阅读内容做基础，并在宽松的阅读和讨论环境中，形成能够让人们自由做出价值判断，并学会尊重他人价值观的一种社会氛围。

好的阅读内容，能够给读者提供价值增量，简单来说就是“有用”。我不愿意以高雅与低俗来划分阅读内容的好坏，那样会让人觉得自大清高。“高雅”和“低俗”是个相对概念，一本传统意义上的高雅书籍，对于一个没读完小学的人来说，其提供的价值可能远不如“内涵段子”里的一则帖子来的大，因为他可能完全不懂高雅书籍里任何一句话的含义，但那则“段子”则可以让他开心一天，谁能否认开心是一种“有用”的价值呢。从这个意义上来说，“高雅”和“低俗”是平等的。

我是“今日头条”的早期用户，用过数月后卸载，从来都不是“内涵段子”、“抖音”或者“火山小视频”的用户，这只能说明我狂妄地认为这些平台上的信息并不能给我带来价值增量，但并不代表我否定这些信息存在的价值。从网上拍山倒海的评论来看，这些平台至少给它们的用户带来了快乐，并且消除了寂寞，这是多么功德无量的事情。所以从这个意义上来说，因为认定“内涵段子”之类内容低俗就将其封杀，某种程度上扼杀了这些内容可以带来的价值增量。

阅读内容能给受众提供多大的价值，并非他人可以判断。马斯洛说人有五层需求，转移到对阅读的需求上也是如此。有的人只图个乐呵，有的人希望获取专业知识，有的人则追寻人生的意义。所以，无论什么内容，总能在某个层面满足某类人的某种需要，而这种需要无所谓高尚或者卑贱，只要它在既定的社会共识范围之内，就有权利得到满足。

但我并非全盘否定这次整改的意义，因为人类心理和生理上的特点，受众很容易被各类“标题党”或极有诱惑力的内容所吸引，在一个良好公共阅读还未完全发育的社会中，适度的引导确实有其意义。我们看到在这些被整改的APP中，夸大事实和诱导阅读层出不穷，其中最伤人的当属为获取高点击量而歪曲事实，这是极其短视和不可持续的行为，即使不被有关部门勒令整改，长此以往也将遭到受众唾弃，因为受众素养不可否认正在不断提高。

好的公共阅读需要提供极其丰富的内容，抛开传统意义上低俗与高雅的偏见，能够满足人们各种各样的需求，哪怕那种需求是极其私密、个人的。当然，并不是任何内容都适合广泛传播，作为大众阅读产品，我们仍要为其划出底线，分清可为与不可为，无论是宏观上的内容方向，还是微观上的标题操作。

好的阅读内容必须在好的阅读环境中，才能发挥它最大的价值。好的阅读环境，是提供自由讨论和思考空间，受众在对阅读内容价值的自行审视和相互讨论中，得出一个让自己信服的结论，选择是否接受或者摒弃这些内容。社会的价值观共识则会在每个个体对价值的判断上，逐步形成。

和以往对网络媒体整改一样，这次“内涵段子”的下架是也是行政强制命令所为，国家广电总局一纸通知就让众多用户在网络上表示“不知所措。”这种强制命令在现阶段可以说是有其积极意义的，但就形成社会价值观共识来说，“一刀切”的办法仍然值得商榷。

前文提到，公共阅读是一种社会参与，人们可以在阅读后自由发表意见，并与他人交流，在赞同与反对声中不断反思，方能自行确定内容对于自己到底价值几何。“内涵段子”经过多年的运营，其实早已有一个稳定的用户群体和价值倾向。它不会交给人多么高深的处世之道或者科学方法，他就是一个让受众开心的世俗平台，觉得受用的人自然会留下，觉得无用的人自然会离开。而跳出“内涵段子”这个个案，在一个公众讨论充分的社会里，违反社会价值共识的内容会被自然淘汰，遭到受众唾弃。而政府，则需要有相信大众的智慧的勇气。

总的来说，好的公共阅读最终还是一种对价值判断和平等的尊重。谈论阅读格调的高低在我看来是自大的表现，而谁也没有权利去笑话他人坚信的价值。

有些人认为今日头条的算法只推荐用户想看的信息，缺少不同观点不同价值观的碰撞，让用户的思维变得单一，我并不同意这种论断。用户订阅某种产品，特别是媒体产品时，就已经默认自己认可了它传递的价值观。《纽约时报》的订户很可能认定了他所代表的新闻专业主义和自由主义倾向，《华尔街日报》的读者则可能偏向保守共和党，金融时报的读者自然也有自己的价值取向。

受众的信念和对自己价值观的认同订阅和不断阅读中得以强化和通透，这未尝不是一件好事。

当然，互联网时代信息多元且爆炸，不同人群对信息内容的不同需求和政府管理之间的矛盾仍然是一个棘手的问题，解决起来也没法一蹴而就，但不论业界还是学界都叫喊了多年的内容分级制仍是一个值得尝试的选择。

首先，内容分级制承认人在生理和心理上的不同需求，这种判断是客观的，无欲无求的人只会是极少数。其次，在这种客观判断的基础上，我们能够针对不同内容做出相应的判断，将负面社会影响降到最低。再次，对于中国来说，我们能够很方便地借鉴其他国家在内容分级制上取得的经验，将其融入中国市场。不可否认，这不会是一片“特效药”，而更像一种“缓释剂”，伴随着受众的成长，逐渐起效。

不过，这需要政府角色的进一步转变，从管理者变为彻底的服务者。

（岳源，田纳西大学新闻系研究生。本文仅代表作者个人观点。责编邮箱bo.liu@ftchinese.com）

cheadline: 特朗普誓言升级对俄制裁
clongleadbody: 在美国、英国和法国对叙利亚化武设施发动导弹袭击后，特朗普政府寻求对阿萨德的后台俄罗斯实施更严厉经济制裁。
cbody:
特朗普政府昨日誓言进一步制裁俄罗斯，原因是俄罗斯对阿萨德政权涉嫌存在的使用化学武器行为进行支持。与此同时，在美国领头进行空袭后，叙利亚政府军再度对平民展开轰炸。

上周六，在法国和英国的配合下，美国对其所称的叙利亚化武设施采取军事行动。目前美国寻求采取更强有力的经济措施作为跟进。

“对俄罗斯的制裁将会出台，”美国驻联合国大使尼基•黑利(Nikki Haley)表示。她补充说，这些措施今日就会宣布。“他们将直接针对经营与阿萨德以及使用化武有牵连的装备的任何类型企业。”

莫斯科和大马士革方面均否认叙利亚领导人巴沙尔•阿萨德(Bashar al-Assad)的政权正在使用化学武器，并指责美国及其盟国采取非法行动。

美国本月已对多个俄罗斯寡头和企业实施了制裁，其中包括一家国有武器贸易公司的子公司RFC Bank——华盛顿方面称，该行负责与叙利亚进行交易。

特朗普政府的一名官员昨日告诉英国《金融时报》，由于俄罗斯支持阿萨德，美国财政部(US Treasury)在考虑制裁俄罗斯的“所有选项”。

特朗普政府已表示，其在叙利亚的行动并不针对俄罗斯，并且仅限于制止使用化武，摧毁伊拉克和黎凡特伊斯兰国(ISIS)，以及反制伊朗的影响力。但是华盛顿近几周对莫斯科采取了更强硬立场，实施新的制裁措施并以惩罚俄罗斯被指在英国用神经毒剂谋害一名前间谍及其女儿为由，驱逐60名俄外交人员。美方还公开承认两国关系紧张。

特朗普上周告诉俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔•普京(Vladimir Putin)，支持阿萨德“要付出巨大代价”，后来还明确威胁要在叙利亚境内对俄罗斯采取军事行动，尽管周末的军事打击并未针对与莫斯科有关的目标。

但美英法的军事打击似乎推动阿萨德的主要后台——俄罗斯和伊朗——走得更近。普京昨日警告西方不要对叙利亚发动后续打击。这位俄罗斯领导人在与伊朗总统哈桑•鲁哈尼(Hassan Rouhani)通电话时表示：“如果这种违反联合国宪章的行动继续下去，将不可避免地导致国际关系混乱。”

鲁哈尼呼吁德黑兰与莫斯科之间进行“更多磋商与合作”。

特朗普宣告上周六的军事打击“大功告成”，但大马士革方面继续攻击反政府武装。志愿组织——叙利亚民防组织(Syrian Civil Defence)的“白头盔”(White Helmet)救援人员表示，反政府武装控制的城镇遭到“28次野蛮空袭”，还有猛烈炮轰。

纳吉姆•博佐尔格梅尔(Najmeh Bozorgmehr)德黑兰补充报道

译者/何黎
eheadline: Trump vows to follow air strikes with more sanctions on Russia
ebody:
The Trump administration vowed yesterday to impose further sanctions against Russia for supporting the Assad regime’s alleged use of chemical weapons, as Syrian government forces renewed a bombing campaign against civilians following US-led air strikes.

The US sought to follow its military action against what it said was chemical weapons sites on Saturday, alongside France and the UK, with stronger economic measures.

“Russia sanctions will be coming down,” said Nikki Haley, the US ambassador to the UN, adding that they would be announced today. “They will be going directly to any sort of companies that were dealing with equipment related to Assad and chemical weapons use.”

Moscow and Damascus deny that Syrian leader Bashar al-Assad’s regime is using chemical weapons and accuse the US and its allies of taking illegal action.

The US imposed sanctions on several Russian oligarchs and businesses this month, including RFC Bank, a subsidiary of a state-owned weapons trading company that Washington said was responsible for transactions with Syria.

A Trump administration official told the Financial Times yesterday that the US Treasury had been looking at “all kinds of options” for sanctions on Russia due to its support for Mr Assad.

The administration has said its actions in Syria were not focused on Russia and were limited to stopping chemical weapons use, destroying Isis and opposing Iranian influence. But Washington has taken a stronger line against Moscow in recent weeks, imposing fresh sanctions, expelling 60 diplomats as punishment for Russia’s alleged use of nerve agents on a former spy and his daughter in the UK, and publicly referring to strained relations.

Mr Trump last week told Russian president Vladimir Putin there was a “big price to pay” for backing Mr Assad and later explicitly threatened Russia with military action in Syria, although the weekend strikes stopped short of attacking targets linked to Moscow.

But the strikes appeared to push Mr Assad’s main backers, Russia and Iran, closer together. Mr Putin yesterday warned against further western strikes against Syria. In a phone call with Iranian president Hassan Rouhani, the Russian leader said “if such actions, carried out in violation of the UN Charter, continue, it will inevitably lead to chaos in international relations”.

Mr Rouhani called for “more consultations and co-operation” between Tehran and Moscow.

Mr Trump declared Saturday’s strikes as “mission accomplished” but Damascus continued to attack rebels. White Helmets rescue workers with the volunteer Syrian Civil Defence Organisation said there were “28 barbaric air strikes” and heavy shelling on rebel-held towns.

Additional reporting by Najmeh Bozorgmehr in Tehran

cheadline: 美国推动世行减少对华贷款
clongleadbody: 世行行长金墉与美国财长姆努钦近日达成妥协，世行将向中国收取更高贷款利率，以换取美国支持该行增资计划。
cbody:
世界银行(World Bank)将改变其贷款模式，使中国获得的贷款减少，这是该行与特朗普政府达成的协议的一部分，目的是争取华盛顿方面支持其130亿美元增资计划。

这项妥协是世行行长金墉(Jim Yong Kim)与美国财长史蒂文•姆努钦(Steven Mnuchin)在最近几天达成的。预计它将在本周于华盛顿举行的国际货币经济组织(IMF)与世行春季会议上主导幕后会谈。

世行已承诺向较贫穷的经济体提供贷款，以换取美国支持其一项计划：即股东国向世行的主要机构国际复兴开发银行(International Bank for Reconstruction and Development)注资75亿美元，另外向其专注于私营部门的机构国际金融公司(International Finance Corporation)注资55亿美元。诸如中国等国家将被划入一个贷款利率更高的新组别。

美国财政部一位高级官员向英国《金融时报》表示，世行应该聚焦的一项改革是向最需要贷款的国家发放贷款。他说，“最终目标”是“让世界经济增长加快，收入中位数提高，而这意味着关键的发展中国家”。

世行的数据显示，去年中国是国际复兴开发银行的最大借款国，获得24亿美元资金。这在国际复兴开发银行放贷总额中的占比为11%，超过其向全球教育和卫生计划提供的资金。

美国的顾虑是世行将贷款发放给自巴拉克•奥巴马(Barack Obama)担任总统以来一直坐拥数万亿美元外汇储备的、与美国竞争的大国。但金墉一直辩驳称，向正在崛起的中国提供贷款有助于巩固世行的未来，同时让世行在中国经济改革中拥有发言权。

特朗普政府推动世行停止向中国等国家放贷的努力可能需要一段时间才能奏效。一些熟悉谈判情况的人士表示，在世行为这些国家确定新的贷款组别的过程中，北京的资金成本不会立即上升。相反，他们表示，向印度等更低组别国家收取的利率可能会降低。

美国智库——全球发展中心(Center for Global Development)的斯科特•莫里斯(Scott Morris)说：“他们不会让世行明年就停止向中国和与中国类似的国家提供贷款。”

世界银行拒绝置评。

译者/何黎
eheadline: China set for fewer World Bank loans as part of $13bn US fundraising deal
ebody:
The World Bank is set to change its lending model so that China will receive fewer loans as part of a deal with the Trump administration to secure Washington’s backing for a $13bn capital increase at the bank.

The compromise was reached between Jim Yong Kim, the bank’s president, and Steven Mnuchin, US Treasury secretary, in recent days. It is expected to dominate talks behind the scenes at this week’s spring meetings in Washington.

The bank has committed to lending to poorer economies in exchange for US backing for a plan by which shareholders would inject $7.5bn into the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development, the World Bank’s main unit, and a further $5.5bn into the International Finance Corporation, its private sector arm. Countries such as China would enter a new lending band charging higher rates for loans.

A senior US Treasury official told the Financial Times that one reform for the World Bank to focus on was lending to countries that need it the most. He said the “ultimate goal” was for “world growth to be faster and for median incomes to be higher and that means in critical developing countries”.

China was the IBRD’s top borrower last year, according to the World Bank, with $2.4bn in funds committed. That was 11 per cent of the IBRD’s lending and more than it committed to education and health programmes worldwide.

The US is concerned about the World Bank lending to a rival power that has been sitting on trillions of dollars in foreign currency reserves since Barack Obama was president. But Mr Kim has long argued that lending to a rising China helps solidify a future for the World Bank while giving the institution a voice in Chinese economic reforms.

The Trump administration’s push to get the World Bank to stop lending to countries such as China is likely to take time to take effect. Some people familiar with the talks said Beijing’s cost of capital at the bank would not immediately rise while the new band for countries in its situation was being established. Instead, they said, the interest charged to countries such as India in lower bands could be reduced.

“They are not going to get the bank to stop lending to China and countries like China next year,” said Scott Morris of the Center for Global Development.

The World Bank declined to comment.

cheadline: 全球最大广告公司掌门人辞职
clongleadbody: 知情者透露，在针对其个人行为的内部调查结束后，由于未签订竞业禁止协议，苏铭天仍可自由创办新的广告公司。
cbody:
据知情人士透露，在针对其个人行为的内部调查结束后，由于没有签订过竞业禁止协议，已卸任WPP首席执行官的苏铭天(Martin Sorrell)可以自由创办一家新的广告公司。

在执掌了这家全球最大的广告公司33年后，苏铭天的离任让WPP不得不在该行业的一个转折点时刻寻找新的领导层。

周末，拥有WPP约2%股权的苏铭天爵士意外辞职，他曾将WPP从一家现金空壳公司打造成一家全球营销巨头。

在致员工的告别信中，苏铭天强调了WPP在他的职业生涯中的重要性，称WPP“面临的问题不仅生死攸关，而且过去、现在和将来一直比这更重要。”他在结尾还暗示了自己下一步要做的事，称：“回到未来。”

WPP拒绝就针对苏铭天的具体指控置评。威凯平和而德律师事务所(Wilmer Hale)一直在调查此案，WPP高级非执行董事尼科尔•塞利格曼(Nicole Seligman)和董事长罗伯托•夸尔塔(Roberto Quarta)领导了调查过程。苏铭天也拒绝就此事置评。

苏铭天的职位将暂时由WPP Digital的首席执行官马克•里德(Mark Read)和WPP欧洲区首席运营官安德鲁•斯科特(Andrew Scott)接替。

然而，该公司很可能会从外部物色接替苏铭天的人选。

天空广播公司(Sky)的首席执行官杰里米•达罗克(Jeremy Darroch)和广告代理公司BBDO的首席执行官安德鲁•罗伯逊(Andrew Robertson)都被列为潜在的接替者。

Pivotal Securities的分析师布赖恩•威泽(Brian Wieser)表示，找人“接苏铭天的班”将是一个挑战，他指出WPP像是一个“碎片化的业务联盟”。

一些分析人士认为，由于智威汤逊(J Walter Thompson)、奥美(OGilvy)和Kantar Media等公司的东家可能被分拆和出售，WPP将会寻找一位重组专家接替苏铭天。

“这家公司将不可避免地走分拆的道路，”Cenkos Securities的分析师亚历克斯•德格罗特(Alex DeGroote)说。“我们认为，Kantar等市场研究资产可能相当快被出售，这将产生30亿至35亿英镑的所得。”

他补充道，WPP在一些“非常有价值”的公司持有大量股权，如Vice Media、Chime Communications以及AppNexus等，这些公司在其资产负债表上价值30亿英镑，但“并未反映在其股价上”。

过去18个月，WPP股东的日子不好过，由于大消费者品牌削减支出，该公司失去了三分之一的市值。全球最大的广告商宝洁(Procter & Gamble)自2015以来削减了7.5亿美元的支出，并计划再削减4亿美元。

苏铭天指责维权投资者推动大品牌削减广告支出，并在报告WPP 2017年全年业绩时承认受到一记“重击”。

eheadline: Martin Sorrell free to compete with WPP after exit
ebody:
Martin Sorrell, who has quit as chief executive of WPP after an investigation into his conduct, is free to start a new advertising venture because he has never had a non-compete agreement, say people briefed on the matter.

His departure after 33 years at the helm of the world’s biggest ad business leaves WPP seeking new leadership at a pivotal time for the industry.

Sir Martin, who owns about 2 per cent of the company that he built from a cash shell into a global marketing powerhouse, resigned unexpectedly over the weekend.

In a farewell note to staff, Sir Martin underscored the role WPP had played in his career, saying the company was “not just a matter of life or death, it was, is and will be more important than that”. He also hinted at his next step when he signed off saying: “Back to the future.”

WPP has declined to comment on the specific allegations against Sir Martin. Law firm Wilmer Hale has been investigating the case, with Nicole Seligman, WPP’s senior non-executive director, and Roberto Quarta, chairman, taking a lead role in the process. Sir Martin also declined to comment.

He will be replaced temporarily by both Mark Read, chief executive of WPP Digital, and Andrew Scott, WPP’s chief operating officer for Europe.

However, the company is likely to look to external candidates to succeed Sir Martin.

Sky’s Jeremy Darroch and Andrew Robertson, chief executive of ad agency BBDO, are among the names being floated as potential successors.

Brian Wieser, an analyst at Pivotal Securities, said it would be a challenge “filling Sorrell’s shoes”, pointing to WPP’s “fragmented federation of businesses”.

Some analysts believe the company will look for a restructuring expert to succeed him because of the likelihood that the owner of companies such as J Walter Thompson, Ogilvy and Kantar Media is broken up and sold.

“It is inevitable that this company is going to be broken up,” said Alex

DeGroote, an analyst at Cenkos Securities. “We think the market research assets such as Kantar could be sold fairly quickly, which would generate £3bn-£3.5bn.”

He added that WPP owned substantial stakes in “really valuable” companies such as Vice Media, Chime Communications and App Nexus that were worth £3bn on its balance sheet but were “not captured in the share price”.

WPP shareholders have endured a miserable 18 months, with the company losing a third of its market value having struggled with cuts in spending by big consumer brands. Procter & Gamble, the world’s biggest advertiser, has trimmed $750m from its spending since 2015 with plans to cut another $400m.

Sir Martin has blamed activist investors for cuts in ad spending by big brands and acknowledged that WPP had been given a “walloping” at its 2017 full-year results.

cheadline: 贸易紧张和通胀威胁全球经济增长
clongleadbody: 布鲁金斯学会和FT编制的TIGER指数显示，全球经济势头已经见顶，通胀上扬、贸易争端和债务等风险给前景蒙上阴影。
cbody:
根据智库布鲁金斯学会(Brookings Institution)和英国《金融时报》编制的追踪指数，全球经济势头已经见顶，各种风险（通胀上扬、贸易争端和债务等）似乎很可能给2018年的前景蒙上阴影。

最新指数显示，推动经济增长的力量依然强劲，但已低于去年的高点，同时金融市场暗示下一阶段将更具挑战性。

得出这些研究发现之前，世界各地发布一连串令人失望的商业调查和疲弱的工业数据，降低了经济学家们对于2018年将是本十年迄今最成功年份的信心。

国际货币基金组织(IMF)总裁克里斯蒂娜•拉加德(Christine Lagarde)上周警告称，如果贸易紧张破坏世界经济，那将是一个“不可原谅的、集体的政策失败”。她暗示，IMF明日发布其最新经济展望时，将不会下调其3.9%的全球增长预测。

较新的“布鲁金斯学会-英国《金融时报》全球经济复苏追踪指标”（Tracking Indexes for the Global Economic Recovery，简称TIGER）显示，最新数据似乎表明势头正在减弱。

布鲁金斯学会的埃斯瓦尔•普拉萨德(Eswar Prasad)表示：“世界经济的增长势头依然强劲，但正在趋缓，原因是贸易战的号角声、地缘政治风险、国内政治断层以及与债务相关的风险已经显现，金融市场已经在反映愈演愈烈的脆弱性。”

TIGER将全球经济以及个别国家的众多反映实体经济活动、金融市场和投资者信心的指标与它们的历史平均值进行比较。

发达经济体的这一综合指数在进入2018年后微跌，原因是产出和就业方面的“硬数据”略微走弱，而金融市场行情大幅下滑。

2017年的投资和生产率数据相当强劲，尤其是在欧元区，但多数经济体的工资增长依然较弱。在特朗普政府减税措施的提振下，美国看起来依然很强劲，但这已开始推高通胀，从而让美联储(Federal Reserve)的加息步伐面临极大挑战。

“美国正在进行一场危险的宏观经济实验：注入可观的财政刺激措施——即使经济看起来正在达到乃至超出潜力的水平运行，”普拉萨德教授表示。

由于第一季度工业产出增长非常疲软，欧洲经济已经降温，英国仍似乎受到英国退欧公投结果对购买力和信心的影响。自2017年底以来，全球商业调查反映了一种下降趋势，由研究咨询机构Markit编制的全球服务和制造业采购经理人指数在3月份跌至16个月以来的低点。

许多新兴市场仍然保持着去年的势头，但随着较富裕国家的利率逐渐攀升，人们越来越担心债务上升和资本外逃的影响。近期刚摆脱经济衰退的俄罗斯和巴西等国，似乎难以恢复元气。

据普拉萨德教授介绍，中国和印度就短期前景而言需要担忧的问题较少，但两国仍需要改革各自的经济体，才能推动在生活水平上追赶发达经济体。

普拉萨德教授说：“中国面临的关键挑战是落实已经提出的改革，不仅是对金融体系，还有对其他经济部门，特别是国有企业。”

在世界各地，2008-09年全球金融危机后货币和财政政策的回旋余地仍然很小，因此各国政府将难以回应一场同步发生的经济低迷。

eheadline: Trade tension and inflation threaten growth
ebody:
Momentum in the global economy has peaked and risks ranging from higher inflation to trade disputes and debt appear likely to taint prospects for 2018, according to the tracking index compiled by the Brookings Institution think-tank and the Financial Times.

The latest update to the index shows that forces contributing to growth remain strong but have levelled off below last year’s peak, while financial markets suggest more challenging times ahead.

The findings follow a series of disappointing business surveys across the world and weak industrial data, which have reduced confidence among economists that 2018 would be the most successful year of the decade so far.

Christine Lagarde, managing director of the IMF, last week warned of an “inexcusable, collective policy failure” if trade tension undermined the world economy. She suggested the fund would not downgrade its 3.9 per cent global growth forecast tomorrow, when it released its latest economic outlook.

The more up-to-date Brookings-FT Tracking Indices for the Global Economic Recovery (Tiger) shows latest data suggesting momentum is fading.

Eswar Prasad of the Brookings Institution said: “The world economy’s growth momentum remains strong but is levelling off as the winds of trade war, geopolitical risks, domestic political fractures, and debt-related risks loom, with financial markets already reflecting mounting vulnerabilities.”

The Tiger index compares many indicators of real activity, financial markets and investor confidence with their historical averages for the global economy and for individual countries.

In advanced economies, the composite index has dipped in 2018 on the back of slightly weaker hard data on output and jobs and a sharp decline in financial market prices.

Investment and productivity were strong in 2017, especially in the eurozone, but wage growth remained weak in most economies. The US still appears strong, buoyed by the Trump administration’s tax cuts, but this is beginning to stir inflation, asking tough questions of the Federal Reserve on the pace of its interest rate rises.

“The US is engaged in a perilous macroeconomic experiment, with the injection of a significant fiscal stimulus even as the economy appears to be operating at or above its potential,” Prof Prasad said.

With very weak industrial output growth in the first quarter, the European economy has cooled and the UK still appears to be suffering the effects of the Brexit vote on purchasing power and confidence. Global business surveys have reflected a decline since the end of 2017 with the global services and manufacturing purchasing managers’ index, produced by Markit, a research consultancy, dropping to a 16-month low in March.

Many emerging markets are still enjoying momentum from last year but there are increasing concerns about rising debt and vulnerability to capital flight as richer countries’ interest rates rise. Those which only recently emerged from recession, Russia and Brazil, are struggling to return to strong levels of activity.

China and India have fewer concerns for the immediate outlook but still need to reform their economies to help living standards catch up with advanced economies, according to Prof Prasad.

Prof Prasad said: “The key challenge for China is the execution of proposed reforms not just to the financial system but also to other parts of the economy, especially the state-owned enterprises.”

Across the world, monetary and fiscal policies remain stretched after the 2008-09 global financial crisis so governments would find it difficult to respond to a synchronised downturn.
